Module it.polimi.ingsw.PSP027
Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP027.Controller

Class SantoriniMatch

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP027.Controller.SantoriniMatch
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class SantoriniMatch
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    SantoriniMatch​(Lobby lobby)
    Constructor: it creates a new match, creating a list for the players that will be filled as the players are added, the same for the list of turns, the gods that will be used in the match and the list of all gods, generates the random unique id of the match, creates a board and sets the variable that tells if the match has started to false

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addPlayer​(Player player)
    Method used to add a player to the match, if it has not started yet
    java.lang.String boardToXMLString()
    Method that builds the string in xml format that represents the board with the players
    void Build​(java.lang.String chosenCell)
    Method that receives the chosen cell from the client and passes it to the turn that will perform the build on the chosen cell with the method doBuild()
    void BuildForAtlas​(java.lang.String chosenCell, java.lang.String build_BorD)
    Method that receives the chosen cell from the client of the player who has Atlas as god card and passes it to the turn that will build a block or a dome with the method doBuildForAtlas()
    void checkLoseCondition​(java.util.List<Player> playersInGame)
    Method that checks if a player is left alone in the match due to the others losing or leaving and therefore triggers the ending of the match.
    void endAction​(java.lang.String chosenCell)
    Method that receives the chosen cell from the client and passes it to the turn that will perform the designated specific end action allowed by the player's god card with the method endAction()

  • Constructor Details

    • SantoriniMatch

      public SantoriniMatch​(Lobby lobby)
      Constructor: it creates a new match, creating a list for the players that will be filled as the players are added, the same for the list of turns, the gods that will be used in the match and the list of all gods, generates the random unique id of the match, creates a board and sets the variable that tells if the match has started to false
      Parameters:
      lobby - the lobby in which the game is contained

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      SantoriniMatch Thread. It controls the various states that the turn passes in its life cycle. This thread creates a turn and until it is completed it checks for winning and losing instances of the playing players. When a turn is completed the cycle restarts for the next player and so on. It continues to do so until the end of the match.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • newTurn

      public Turn newTurn()
      Method that creates a new turn for the first player in the list
      Returns:
      the turn created

    • getTurn

      public Turn getTurn()
      Method to get the current turn being played in the match
      Returns:
      the turn

    • setTurn

      public void setTurn​(Turn turn)
      Method that sets a turn as the current turn of the match
      Parameters:
      turn - turn to set as the match's turn

    • hasPlayers

      public boolean hasPlayers()
      Method to use in order to check if there are no players in the match
      Returns:
      true if the match has players, otherwise false

      the board

    • rotatePlayers

      public void rotatePlayers()
      Method that changes the list of players in order to rotate them. EXAMPLE: players A , B and C will be rotated to B, C and A. The players will be rotated with each turn in order to have each time as the first player the one that is playing the turn

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers​(java.util.List<Player> players)
      Method that sets the list of players
      Parameters:
      players - players to set as the match's players

    • getPlayers

      public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
      Method to gets the list of players in the match
      Returns:
      the list of players

    • getGodCardsList

      public java.util.List<GodCard> getGodCardsList()
      Method to get the list of god cards
      Returns:
      the list of god cards

    • GetRequiredNumberOfPlayers

      public int GetRequiredNumberOfPlayers()
      Method to get the number of players that will play this match
      Returns:
      the required players, which can be 2 or 3

    • SetRequiredNumberOfPlayers

      public void SetRequiredNumberOfPlayers​(int playersCount)
      Method that sets the required number of players as the number of players that will play in the match (chosen by the gamer)
      Parameters:
      playersCount - number of players that this match will require

    • checkLoseCondition

      public void checkLoseCondition​(java.util.List<Player> playersInGame)
      Method that checks if a player is left alone in the match due to the others losing or leaving and therefore triggers the ending of the match.
      Parameters:
      playersInGame - current players in the game to check if there's only one left.

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(Player player)
      Method used to add a player to the match, if it has not started yet
      Parameters:
      player - is the player that is to be added to the list of players

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer​(Player playerToRemove)
      Method that removes the player received and all his attributes from the game. If the match had already started it processes the removing of the player considering that it will loose the game and therefore notifying the other players of this. If the match had not started yet, it proceeds to notify the players that they have to wait again for another player to join before starting the match.
      Parameters:
      playerToRemove - player to be removed

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Method that does the setup of the game. It notifies the players that they have entered the match and the communication with the client regarding the playing of the match actually starts with the server that asks the first player that entered the match to choose #numberofplayers gods among the possible god cards

    • endGame

      public void endGame​(Player playerWinner)
      Method that ends the game if the win conditions are verified
      Parameters:
      playerWinner - player that has won the game

    • setGodCardsInUse

      public void setGodCardsInUse​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> chosengods)
      Method that sets the god cards in use with the god cards chosen by the user (2 or 3 cards depending of the required number of players of the match)
      Parameters:
      chosengods - list of the names of the gods chosen by the user

    • setGodCardForPlayer

      public void setGodCardForPlayer​(Player player, java.lang.String chosengod)
      Method that assigns the chosen god card by the user to its player's god card
      Parameters:
      player - player that has chosen the god card
      chosengod - name of the god that the player has chosen

    • setFirstPlayer

      public void setFirstPlayer​(java.lang.String chosenplayer)
      Method that sets the chosen first player by the user as the first player of the game
      Parameters:
      chosenplayer - name of the player that the player has chosen

    • setWorkersStartPosition

      public void setWorkersStartPosition​(Player player, java.util.List<java.lang.String> chosenpositions)
      Method that sets the chosen starting positions of a player and updates the board
      Parameters:
      chosenpositions - positions chosen where to place the workers
      player - player who is placing its workers

    • setChosenWorker

      public void setChosenWorker​(java.lang.String worker)
      Method that receives the worker from the client and passes it to the turn that will set is as the chosen worker of the turn with the method setChosenWorker.
      Parameters:
      worker - int representing the id of the cell containing the worker chosen by the user

    • MoveWorker

      public void MoveWorker​(java.lang.String chosenCell)
      Method that receives the chosen cell from the client and passes it to the turn that will set the new position for the worker with the method MoveWorker()
      Parameters:
      chosenCell - int representing the id of the chosen cell

    • passMove

      public void passMove()
      Method called by the client that lets the player skip the Move phase calling the turn's method passMove()

    • Build

      public void Build​(java.lang.String chosenCell)
      Method that receives the chosen cell from the client and passes it to the turn that will perform the build on the chosen cell with the method doBuild()
      Parameters:
      chosenCell - int representing the id of the chosen cell

    • BuildForAtlas

      public void BuildForAtlas​(java.lang.String chosenCell, java.lang.String build_BorD)
      Method that receives the chosen cell from the client of the player who has Atlas as god card and passes it to the turn that will build a block or a dome with the method doBuildForAtlas()
      Parameters:
      chosenCell - int representing the id of the chosen cell
      build_BorD - string that states whether the player wants to build a block or a dome

    • passBuild

      public void passBuild()
      Method called by the client that lets the player skip the Build phase calling the turn's method passBuild()

    • endAction

      public void endAction​(java.lang.String chosenCell)
      Method that receives the chosen cell from the client and passes it to the turn that will perform the designated specific end action allowed by the player's god card with the method endAction()
      Parameters:
      chosenCell - int representing the id of the chosen cell

    • passEnd

      public void passEnd()
      Method called by the client that lets the player skip the End phase calling the turn's method passEnd()

    • boardToXMLString

      public java.lang.String boardToXMLString()
      Method that builds the string in xml format that represents the board with the players
      Returns:
      the string to attach in the data node of the command string to send to the client

    • sendUpdatedBoard

      public void sendUpdatedBoard​(java.lang.String nicknamePlayingPlayer)
      Method that sends the updated board to each player, useful for those who are not currently playing their turn as it gives them the possibility to watch the progression of the game in between their turn.
      Parameters:
      nicknamePlayingPlayer - player who is playing its turn, used by the View to display who is currently playing the turn visible by everyone.
